page.title: 19Brecon Byelection July 4 '85
page.content: The Brecon and Radnor byelection resulted from the death of the Conservative M.P., Mr Tom Hooson, who had achieved a majority of 8,754 in the 1983 General Election. It has been a byelection of great significance to Mrs Margaret Thatcher's present administration, because Brecon was regarded as a safe Conservative seat- and the result was a blow to "Thatcher monetarism." {Result :R.A.Livesey}(Lib/S.D.P){13,753 { R.Willey} (Labour) { 13,194 { C.Butler} (Cons.) {10,631 { Mrs J.Davis}(Plaid Cymru){ 435 { Lord D.E.Sutch { }(Monster Raving Loony) {202 { R.Everest} (One Nation Cons.){ 154 { A.Genillard} (Cure M.S.){ 43 { Majority : 559 {
